IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE CONTINUING EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION SERVICES FOR PRIVATE FLEET PROFESSIONALS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE CONTINUING EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION SERVICES FOR PRIVATE FLEET PROFESSIONALS.
IRS990.Desc: PRIVATE FLEET MANAGEMENT INSTITUTE:THE ANNUAL PRIVATE FLEET MANAGEMENT INSTITUTE IS A FIVE-DAY INTENSIVE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM OFFERING COURSES ON FLEET FINANCE, OPERATIONS, LEGAL, REGULATORY AND SAFETY COMPLIANCE, HUMAN RESOURCES, MAINTENANCE AND EQUIPMENT. APPROXIMATELY 80-100 INDIVIDUALS PARTICIPATE IN THIS PROGRAM ANNUALLY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CERTIFICATION PROGRAM PROMOTION:THE CERTIFIED TRANSPORTATION PROFESSIONALS (CTP) PROGRAM RECOGNIZES TOP PRIVATE FLEET PROFESSIONALS. MORE THAN 60 NEW INDIVIDUALS EARN THEIR CTP CERTIFICATION EACH YEAR. SINCE THE INCEPTION OF THE PROGRAM IN 1993, OVER 1,400 INDIVIDUALS HAVE EARNED CTP CERTIFICATION; OVER 620 INDIVIDUALS HOLD ACTIVE CERTIFICATION.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE A, PART IV, SECTION A, LINE 2
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: NPTC IS A 501(C)(6) ORGANIZATION THAT MEETS THE PUBLIC SUPPORT TEST DESCRIBED IN 509(A)(2).

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE A, PART IV, SECTION A, LINE 3B
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: NPTC'S PUBLIC SUPPORT PERCENTAGE UNDER 509(A)(2) FOR 2013-2017 IS 97.56% AND ITS INVESTMENT INCOME PERCENTAGE IS 2.44%

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE A, PART IV, SECTION A, LINE 3C
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: ITTM PROVIDES NO DIRECT SUPPORT TO NPTC. ITS EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION PROGRAM SUPPORT THE MISSION OF NPTC.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE A, PART IV, SECTION A, LINE 1
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: ITTM HAS A HISTORIC AND CONTINUING RELATIONSHIP. THE ORGANIZATION IS ESTABLISHED AND ADMINISTERED BY THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INSTITUTE FOR TRUCK TRANSPORTATION MANAGEMENT (ITTM) IS EXEMPT FROM THE PAYMENT OF INCOME TAX UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTIONS 501(C)(3). NPTC FOLLOWS GUIDANCE REGARDING THE RECOGNITION OF UNCERTAIN INCOME TAX POSITIONS. NPTC BELIEVES IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR UNRELATED TRADE OR BUSINESS POSITIONS AND, AS A RESULT, DOES NOT HAVE UNCERTAIN INCOME TAX POSITIONS THAT HAVE A MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE APPLICATION OF THIS GUIDANCE HAD NO IMPACT ON NPTC'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. PCC HAS NO ACTIVITY, AND THEREFORE NO TAXABLE INCOME THAT COULD RESULT IN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

COMPENSATION IS SET BY A RELATED ORGANIZATION, THE NATIONAL PRIVATE TRUCK COUNCIL (NPTC). THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE (COMPOSED OF THE BOARD CHAIR, VICE-CHAIR, TREASURER AND SECRETARY) MAKES COMPENSATION DECISIONS FOR THE CEO UTILIZING AVAILABLE INDUSTRY COMPARABILITIY COMPENSATION DATA. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE APPROVES COMPENSATION DECISIONS AT OFFICIAL MEETINGS WHICH ARE DOCUMENTED. THE SAME PROCESS IS UTILIZED FOR OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES. THE PROCESS WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS CONSISTS OF INDIVIDUALS FROM NATIONAL PRIVATE TRUCK COUNCIL (NPTC) MEMBER COMPANIES IN GOOD STANDING. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE CHAIR AND TREASURER OF NPTC, WHO SHALL AUTOMATICALLY SERVE AS GOVERNORS, ALL ITTM GOVERNORS MUST BE ELECTED BY A MAJORITY OF THE ITTM BOARD OF GOVERNORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RETURN IS PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM BASED ON DATA PROVIDED BY MANAGEMENT. MANAGEMENT AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF RELATED (PARENT) ORGANIZATION PERFORMS A THOROUGH REVIEW PRIOR TO SUBMISSION TO THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PER ITTM'S BYLAWS, EACH GOVERNOR RECOGNIZES THAT HE OR SHE HAS AN AFFIRMATIVE DUTY TO AVOID CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, WHICH MAY OCCUR DURING THEIR TENURE AND TO REPORT SUCH A DEVELOPMENT TO THE CHAIR SHOULD ONE ARISE. ANY GOVERNOR HAVING A DUALITY OF INTEREST OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST ON ANY MATTER SHALL NOT VOTE OR USE HIS OR HER PERSONAL INFLUENCE ON THE MATTER AND SHALL NOT BE COUNTED IN DETERMINING THE QUORUM FOR THE MEETING, EVEN WHERE PERMITTED BY LAW. THE MINUTES OF THE MEETING SHALL REFLECT THAT A DISCLOSURE WAS MADE, BY WHOM, THE ABSTENTION FROM VOTING, AND THE QUORUM SITUATION. EVERY NEW GOVERNOR SHALL BE ADVISED OF THIS POLICY UPON ENTERING ON THE DUTIES OF HIS OR HER OFFICE BY THE CHAIR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH AFFILIATED ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE NOT MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
